text.p: Fires which raged through Kazakhstan's steppes this week destroyed more than 5,000 hectares of grassland, the interior ministry said on Thursday.

A ministry spokesman said the fires raged for six days in the Central Asian country's Kurchumsky district, located near the Chinese border about 1,100 km (700 miles) northeast of the Kazakh capital Almaty.

He said over 600 volunteers, firefighters and police finally brought the fires under control on Tuesday. The cause of the fire was not yet known but hot, dry weather had hampered firefighting operations.
